intro: Lasiochlamys grossicrenata, commonly known as the rough-haired bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Lasiochlamys grossicrenata is part of the Campanulaceae family, known for its showy, tubular flowers.
